#Text=93-year-old Michigan man freezes to death after electric company limits his power usage
#Text=Wednesday , January 28 , 2009
#Text=Marvin Schur , a 93-year-old man from Bay City , Michigan has died after the electric company limited his electric use due to his failure to pay over US $ 1,000 in past-due payments .
#Text=Bay City Electric Light & Power installed a power-limiting device on his home on January 13 .

#Text=The device would limit the amount of power the resident uses and would essentially shut it off if that limit is reached , or if the resident fails to pay the outstanding bill within 10 days of installation .
#Text=In order for the electricity to be turned back on , the limiter must be reset by pushing a button .
#Text=Bay City power says that a warning , indicating that the power was to be turned off and a limiter installed , had been placed on Schur 's front door .
#Text=Despite that , the company says that they are now " looking at our website and possibly doing an automated phone message .

#Text=We obviously need to get the word out .

_	_	_	_

#Text=The autopsy performed on Schur 's body concluded that he had died  a slow , painful death " caused by hypothermia .

column1: #Text=Dr. Kanu Virani , who performed the autopsy , explained : " Hypothermia shuts the whole system down , slowly .

#Text=It 's not easy to die from hypothermia without first realizing your fingers and toes feel like they 're burning .

#Text=It was less than 32 degrees Fahrenheit ( 0 Centigrade ) in Schur 's home when neighbors found Schur dead on January 17 .

#Text=Virani commented that it was his first time performing an autopsy on a body in which  the person froze to death indoors . "

column1: #Text=" His furnace was not running - the insides of his windows were full of ice the morning we found him , " said George A. Pauwels Jr. , who was with his wife when they found Schur 's body .
#Text=In Michigan it is illegal for a utility company to disconnect power to any home between November 1 and March 31 when a resident is over the age of 65 .
#Text=Limiters are also not supposed to be used during that time frame .
#Text=However , municipally-owned electric utilities like the one in Bay City , are not regulated by the state .
#Text=The Michigan state attorney general 's office has launched an investigation into the incident .
#Text=Residents around Schur 's home say he was hard of hearing , and the city states that the device 's function and operation were never explained to him .
#Text=When word of the story got around , people from all over the United States began to call the city in anger .

#Text=" I 've taken calls from Canada , Massachusetts , Texas , New York , Alabama - and that 's just the ones I can think of off the top of my head , " said Melody Roth of the city 's administrative office , who also added that people from all over are " calling all city departments , not just our office . "
#Text=Schur has no known children , and his wife had died several years prior to the incident .
